title: Airside Experience Associate - MIA - Part-Time Per Diem
description: Part-time role supporting sports charter, commercial, and private aircraft operations at MIA with a flexible schedule and a 4-hour pay minimum for per diem shifts, ensuring smooth airside experiences for travelers.   As an Airside Experience Associate , you play a hands-on role in delivering safe, efficient, and guest-focused service within the private aviation environment. Your support helps keep day-to-day operations running smoothly, while also contributing to an exceptional ground experience for guests and crews alike. You’ll be responsible for the careful handling of baggage, cargo, and freight, as well as monitoring secure airport access points - all with a mindset of service, precision, and safety . Whether you’re managing ramp activity or assisting with aircraft support, your presence contributes directly to a positive and seamless guest journey. This role requires flexibility to work different shifts, including nights, holidays, and weekends, with the ability to operate in both indoor and outdoor conditions near active aircraft and ground equipment and in varying weather conditions. If you take pride in operational excellence and love creating exceptional guest experiences, this is your opportunity to make an impact from the ground up.

title: Airside Experience Specialist - HPN - (Part Time)
description: As an Airside Experience Specialist , you are the face of our private aviation terminal, delivering a seamless, personalized, and welcoming experience for every guest, crew member, and aircraft in our care. In this dynamic role, you'll combine exceptional hospitality with hands-on operational support to ensure our guests feel cared for, from wheels down to wheels up. You’ll operate ground service equipment and perform aircraft ground services while engaging guests with professionalism and a service-first mindset . This role requires schedule flexibility, including nights, weekends and holidays, and the ability to thrive in outdoor environments around active aircraft and in varying weather conditions. If you enjoy creating memorable guest experiences in a fast-paced, luxury-driven environment – and you're excited by the energy of the runway – this is the role for you.

title: Operations Manager - EYW
description: As an Operations Manager , you are a critical part of the base leadership team, overseeing day-to-day operations that ensure the safe, efficient, and high-touch delivery of services for private aviation guests, crews, and residents. You lead by example, coordinating and directing team activities while upholding Signature Aviation’s gold standard of hospitality. In addition to your leadership responsibilities, you’ll occasionally step into frontline duties alongside your team, using your deep understanding of company policies and operational procedures to ensure a seamless guest experience throughout the terminal. This is a dynamic role requiring flexibility in scheduling (including nights, weekends, and holidays) and the ability to work in both indoor and outdoor environments near active aircraft and ground service equipment. From unpredictable weather to high-paced situations, your calm, capable leadership keeps everything running smoothly and guests feeling valued . If you're passionate about leading teams, elevating guest experiences, and thriving in a hands-on, fast-moving aviation setting, this role is built for you.

title: Airside Experience Specialist - LGB
description: The Airside Experience Specialist is responsible for a variety of duties that contribute towards safely providing requested services for general aviation aircraft, crew and other guests. An Airside Experience Specialist routinely operates ground service equipment and uses knowledge of the company’s policies and procedures to provide efficient and exceptional service to the guests of the private aviation terminal (PAT). An Airside Experience Specialist must be able to work flexible schedules, including night, holiday, and weekend shifts. Certain functions may be performed in varying weather and environmental conditions such as precipitation, extreme temperatures, jet engine fumes, dust, and noise. The tasks are performed inside and outside near stationary and moving aircraft (including spinning propellers and engines).

title: Accounting Associate
description: The Accounting Associate plays a key role in ensuring the financial accuracy, compliance, and operational efficiency of the Fixed Base Operation (FBO). This position is responsible for the timely and accurate completion of all required FBO accounting activities, including fuel management, reconciliations, and reporting. The role also provides administrative and coordination support to local leadership and other functional teams as needed to ensure smooth day-to-day operations.

title: MAINTENANCE PROGRAM ENGINEER (STRUCTURE)
description: SONOVISION’s Maintenance Program team supports customers in activities relevant to aviation maintenance planning & execution, maintenance production, optimization, engineering support, and consultation supports with capability to customize niche scope based on customer’s need. Key Responsibilities: As a Maintenance Program Engineer, you will hold important responsibility in contributing to customer’s product (aircraft) safety. Your key responsibilities will include: Perform technical assessment of maintenance report/findings from operator or maintenance organization: To identify if the report is relevant for the selected maintenance task, To categorize valid/relevant maintenance reports base on the applicable rules provided by aircraft manufacturer / OEM, To analyze and provide detailed technical evaluation of the maintenance reports base on assessment criteria provided by aircraft manufacturer / OEM. Analyze and compile technical justification upon completing technical evaluation of affected maintenance tasks: To produce technical justification with the result of the statistical data analysis base on the given policy by aircraft manufacturer / OEM, To write technical justification for possible escalation/de-escalation of the maintenanceinterval base on Design Office feedback, in-service experience and Scheduled Maintenance Team feedback, To provide recommendation/proposal for new maintenance interval. Coordinate, consult and/or working with multi-stakeholder team involving flight ops, scheduled maintenance, design office, operators: o To obtain required technical and/or operational inputs, o Timely follow-up open topics for affected technical dossiers, o Review & update action plans for achieving expected changes. Responsible to conduct/attend technical meetings with aircraft manufacturer / OEM (Airbus departments such as Design Office, Safety Assessment team, Scheduled Maintenance Team), Operator, Authority, etc. Ensure transfer of in-service experience and maintenance program activities to the management, to other departments for continuous improvement. Anticipation studies and industrialization preparation relevant to aircraft structural repair projects and maintenance programs. Skills and Competencies: Strong analytical skill within engineering scope, with aerospace engineering background. Possesses strong knowledge with aircraft maintenance documentations such as (AMM, AMP, IPC, SRM etc) and preferably expertise with Airbus fleet. Possesses technical knowledge and experience in aircraft maintenance planning, procedures and operations. Proficient in interpreting aircraft structure drawings and GD&T. Understanding of aerospace materials, heat/surface treatments, fasteners, and bonding techniques. Ability to work in a team and to be autonomous to complete full task alone. Excellent verbal communication & presentation skills. Qualification : Diploma in Aircraft Maintenance or Aviation Engineering, or equivalent. Experience : >3 years of experience in aircraft structure repair or maintenance program. Work Environment: Office setting. May be required to travel based on project needs. Benefits: Group Health insurance after three (3) months of employment. Professional development opportunities.

title: WORKSHOP TECHNICIAN - AVIONICS AS565 / AS332
description: If you meet the requirement, please call/Whatsapp: Mr. Richard - (Recruiter) Mobile:  +6016 9368682 BASIC FUNCTION AND SCOPE (SUMMARY) Assist the Avionics Supervisor to accomplish aviation unit and intermediate maintenance inspections services. QUALIFICATIONS High School Completion of a formal avionics training course from an accredited military or civilian aeronautical school. Knowledgeable on The Army Maintenance Management System (TAMMS) preferable. EXPERIENCE Minimum of 5 Years Must have a minimum of 5 years working with rotary aircraft powertrain systems and subsystems. LANGUAGE SKILLS Must be able to read, write and understand English. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Repairs, replaces, and performs operational/functional tests on instruments, radios, navigation and aircraft flight control equipment, stabilization systems, avionics systems. Troubleshoots equipment and traces avionic equipment wiring harnesses using technical manuals and schematic drawings to diagnose and isolate faults and effect repairs. Diagnose malfunctions using special and common hand tools, test measurement and diagnostic equipment. Requisition aircraft parts, and maintain shop and bench stock for repair of aircraft avionics equipment. Inspects and prepares forms and records in accordance with DA PAM 738-751. Train host national personnel on the proper maintenance of the avionics/instrument systems. Responsible for tools and equipment inventory assigned by the supervisor. Responsible for replacing electronic parts on PCB level using soldering / resoldering technics. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY None. SUPERVISORY RECEIVED Reports to Supervisor COMMUNICATIONS Must be able to communicate well with others, instill a teamwork mentality, and lead by example. OTHER FACTORS Must have good knowledge of Special Operations mission requirements, equipment and maintenance programs. Must have strong program management background with a good understanding of contract law and terminology used in aviation contracts. Must have a good working knowledge of all computer applications. Must have strong charismatic and delegating attributes. Must work well with other departments.

title: LEGAL COUNSEL
description: Job Description: The Legal & Compliance Counsel will be part of the APAC L&C team providing legal and compliance support for all APAC Airbus entities, in particular, Malaysia. We are seeking a motivated and experienced In-house generalist legal counsel or lawyer with at least 6-8 years Post-Qualified Experience to join our dynamic legal team. The successful candidate will play a crucial role in providing comprehensive legal advice and support across a wide range of legal matters, including contact review, drafting, and negotiation, as well as litigation, and compliance with applicable laws and regulations, and effectively managing legal risks for the organization. Business-level proficiency in English and Bahasa Melayu. Additional proficiency in any other APAC or European language. More precisely: Legal & Corporate Secretarial Matters Providing legal and compliance services to the Business Units, Functions Group entities present in APAC, in particular Malaysia and their respective operations Work with business stakeholders to assess legal implications and potential risk, help them identify, understand and manage both short-term and long-term risks to the business Providing counsel regarding both legal framework and what is appropriate for all Airbus APAC activities across divisions  Provide legal support for the various acquisition, re-organisation, integration, development and divestment projects in APAC Support the coordination of input of outside counsel with the internal members of the project team e.g. Group legal and compliance departments, tax, finance, HR, export control, insurance, real estate and relevant business stakeholders  Monitoring compliance of the transactions with relevant and applicable laws and regulations Coordinate with and support where necessary other members of the legal and compliance department Coordinate and review corporate secretarial documentation in respect of Airbus entities Drafting and reviewing agreements for various transactions, notably:  (i) Aviation services: MRO services: parts repair, lease and exchange services, line and base airframe maintenance, spare parts management and supply, sales, fleet technical management services, inventory technical management services etc  (ii) Procurement: aircraft spare parts, aviation subcontracting services, jigs and tools, industrial maintenance, infrastructure and construction operations, general procurement  (iii) Real Estate: structure, draft and negotiate contracts relating to real estate operations (purchasing, sale, construction, lease, etc.)  (iv) Compliance-related contracts with third parties - e.g. sponsorships, resellers, channel partners, sales intermediaries Drafting, adapting and managing standard contract templates depending on the business needs and ensure proper coordination with all relevant functions (Export Control, Insurance, Tax and Finance etc.) Compliance Under the supervision of the Regional Ethics and Compliance Manager and HO Legal & Compliance - Malaysia: Support compliance initiatives and assist with adapted deployment and monitoring with the tools and systems used by Airbus Support coordination within the APAC Region on policies, regulations and legal processes Support the Legal & Compliance function with the roll-out and management of training sessions and clear communications on anti-corruption laws and internal compliance policies for Airbus employees based in APAC Support deployment of key elements of the anti-corruption programme for due diligence, monitoring and auditing of business partners, agents, political advisors, offset providers and other types of third parties that present an elevated risk from a compliance perspective Conducting of risk-based training of business partners and other third parties on Ethics & Compliance Other duties reasonably determined from time to time by the Legal & Compliance Department and the Company Assisting in monitoring all corporate matters Assist with preparation and conducting of legal trainings in order to develop legal awareness for operations in APAC, in particular Malaysia Supporting on coordination with external counsel on advice and support, and support internal communication/preparation on litigation/arbitration matters  Assist with the conducting of Compliance Investigations affecting Airbus entities (pre-investigation planning, data collection, witness interviews, final report drafting, etc.) Support the intake and processing of reports received through Airbus’ whistle-blowing system, “OpenLine”

description: Description Airline Flight Academy (AFA) , flight training partner for a number of airline clients including Ryanair, are continuing to accept applications for their self-sponsored B737 type-rating programme! Successful candidates will be trained to the highest standards and will get the opportunity to fly the newest B737 8200 for Ryanair Group, paving the way to becoming the airline’s future Captains. The B737 Type Rating Cadet Programme offers exceptional benefits: World-Class Training with a proven track record Industry-Leading Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) Competitive Salary Starting from Base Training Reasons to become a Ryanair pilot: Job security – Become part of one of the most successful airline groups in the world Structured Command Upgrade programme Fastest time to Captaincy Unrivalled career progression – opportunities for SFI, LTC, TRE, TRI, & Base Captain The best and most stable roster in the business No planned overnights and rosters published 4 weeks in advance Great base opportunities available at many locations across the network Outstanding Earnings Potential New modern fleet and the opportunity to fly the brand-new Boeing 737 aircraft including the new B737 8200 What We Require From You! Hold unrestricted right to live and work in the EU and or/UK. Date of Birth – (Not over 65) Licence Type – must have a valid  EASA  (CPL) Frozen ATPL (Air Transport Pilots Licence) and/or Dual Licence (UK & EASA). Candidates who possess only a UK licence are eligible to fly solely for the Ryanair UK fleet. Validity of  EASA  Medical – Must hold a valid EU (Part-MED) issued Class 1 medical certificate. Hold a valid  EASA  multi-engine instrument rating. Hold a certificate of satisfactory completion of  EASA  Advanced Upset Prevention and Recovery Training (AUPRT) in accordance with  FCL.745.A. Please note your certificate must state that training was completed in accordance with FCL.745.A. Hold a certificate of satisfactory completion of  EASA APS MCC  in accordance with AMC2 FCL.735.A.  Please be aware that standard MCC and MCC/JOC are no longer accepted. Ryanair Future Flyer Academy Applicants who hold a certificate of mentored training completion from one of our official  partner flight schools , including mentored APS MCC training; Will be given preference during the initial selection process and priority on Type Rating courses. Will be at a distinct advantage in the interview and assessment process. *Must have a flight school report Your FLIGHT SCHOOL REPORT must be written in English. The document MUST also be signed by your Flight School’s HOT (Head of Training). This requirement applies to both Integrated and Modular students. This report MUST also contain ALL ATPL results ( detailing any repeats ), CPL & MEIR series passes, and information relating to your performance throughout training. Cadets who have conducted a modular course need to have 100 hours as Pilot-in-Command (PIC), or 70 hours as PIC if completed during a course of integrated flying training as set out in Appendix 3 A, C & D to Part-FCL and AMC1 to Appendix 3 A, C & D. English Language Proficiency –minimum required proficiency Level is Operational Level (Level 4). (Written proficiency is required at Operational level). Ability to pass an enhanced background check and meet all other regulatory requirements.

title: TECHNICAL REPRESENTATIVE - BASE MAINTENANCE

title: TYPE RATING INSTRUCTOR (TRI)
description: Job Description: The Type Rating Instructor (TRI) / Type Rating Examiner (TRE) is responsible to instruct and/or check airline crew converting to Airbus on all operational, technical and performance aspects for a specific type (or types). The contract is based in Singapore. The Instructor/Examiner is also responsible to assist the Head of Training (HOT) with other training related duties when assigned. The instructor will conduct flight training and simulator training for various international customers. Commuting is not possible. She/he will represent Airbus in front of the operators, and in front of the Authorities. The Airbus TRI-TRE could work with different teams across the world and will have opportunities to develop her/his expertise in various fields and roles, including management / project positions. Job Responsibilities Instruct airline crew converting to Airbus on all operational and technical aspects for a specific type (or types) using Flight Training Devices, Fixed Base Simulators, Full Flight Simulators, Aircrafts, Lecture rooms, in order to ensure their capability to carry out safely and correctly all normal and emergency procedures required by Airworthiness authorities. Conduct theoretical training for type-rating courses, flight operations courses and aircraft performance Adhere to Airbus standard policy and standardisation as required by Flight Development and Flight Standardization & Policy. Instruct and/or check the crews within the defined time limits. Evaluates the crews’ progression. Decides, if required, on the necessity to accord extra training to achieve the required level of proficiency and competence as defined in the training objectives. Conduct Base Trainings for airline crew on applicable Airbus aircrafts. Conduct Line Trainings (Initial Operating Experiences (IOE)) for airline crew on applicable Airbus aircrafts. Conduct aircraft type rating skills test, license proficiency checks or operator proficiency checks on applicable Airbus aircrafts type Participate in review or development of training programme as assigned by HOT. Conduct assessments of instructors. Conduct standardization duties if appointed as Airbus Standardizer. Maintain a high level of airmanship to teach in a multicultural environment. Assist with flight training audits and Flight Simulator Training Device (FSTD) fly-outs and qualifications. Any other duties as assigned by Head of Training. Job Requirements: Hold an EASA (European Union Aviation Safety Agency) ATPL (Airline Transport Pilot Licence) License Hold an EASA Medical Class 1 certificate Hold a valid EASA Type Rating on the relevant Airbus aircraft type Hold a valid EASA Instructor certificate on the relevant Airbus aircraft type unrestricted (LIFUS or Landing Training) Hold a valid EASA Examiner certificate on the relevant Airbus aircraft type is a plus Hold or have held a Low Visibility Operations qualification (at least one auto land in Airbus Fly-by-wire (FBW) aircraft as Captain) Hold or have held an ETOPS (Extended-range Twin-engine Operations Performance Standards) approval qualification With minimum 8000 hours as Pilot With minimum 5000 hours on jet large aircraft With minimum 2500 hours as Captain on Airbus aircraft With minimum 1500 hours on Airbus FBW aircraft type(s) With minimum 500 hours as Captain or instructor assigned to conduct LIFUS (Line Flying Under Supervision) / IOE Evidence base training / Competences Base Training Assessment expertise is a plus Preference will be given to candidates who have completed the Airbus Pilot Instructor Course (APIC) Fluent in English, minimum English Language Proficiency Rating of 5 in order to communicate with all trainees

description:
=== Job Overview ===

=== Description ===
Want to bring the world to Scandinavia through the flavors by SAS?
Are you passionate about food and wine and want to experience the pride of keeping Scandinavia’s Travelers safe and happy in the skies?
Your commitment as an Air Steward onboard SAS’ flights is to exceed customers’ expectations on both European and Intercontinental flights. You will be responsible for organizing, structuring, and supervising the dining experience in SAS Business, Plus and Go Class. Additionally, you will play a vital role in guiding and briefing colleagues on the overall workflow throughout the flight.
At SAS Scandinavia, we’re offering a chance to turn your passion into a flying career. One week you might wake up in New York, the next in Tokyo. With permanent 80% employment and competitive conditions, you’ll enjoy adventure, and the unique experience of having the world as your workplace.
Qualifications and Experience
Security Requirements
Personal Qualities
To be successful in the role of Air Steward, you should be a natural team player who is safety-conscious and responsible. You must be structured and punctual, always staying one step ahead. Thriving in a fast-paced environment and maintaining a high threshold for stress are essential. You should be solution-oriented, able to see opportunities, and capable of improvising while adhering to routines and procedures ensuring each flight is as exceptional and memorable as their last SAS flight.

Korean speakers living in Copenhagen are encouraged to apply.
If you meet the above qualifications and would like to join SAS Cabin Crew team, we encourage you to submit your application by clicking “Apply Now”.
Our Recruitment Journey
The first courses for this position will be from October 2025 to Spring 2026. As a result, response time may vary between candidates. If you have not received a rejection, please consider yourself still an applicable candidate. You are always welcome to contact us at cc@aapaviation.com.

=== Requirements & Details ===
• Minimum 2 years of work experience from the service industry.
• Hands-on experience in food and beverage, from fast food to banquets, conferences, or waiter/waitress roles.
• Training in hospitality, cooking, or wine is a bonus.
• Experience as a Cabin Crew is an advantage.
• Minimum 18 years old.
• Height between 160 cm and 190 cm (without shoes).
• Completed education to a minimum level of high school or equivalent level.
• Fluent in English language (Berlitz level B2/gym. Min. B).
• Strong swimming skills.
• Able to comply with uniform regulations. Visible tattoos are allowed below the neck, excluding hands and chest. One small, discreet, tattoo, no larger than 1,5cm is however acceptable on the hand and right behind the ear (not extending onto back of head or neck).
• Valid EU passport allowing free travel worldwide.
• Eligible to live and work permanently in Denmark.
• Employment requires an approved security interview/background check for access cards, an approved/passed training course, and that you meet the company’s requirements set for cabin crew.
• Good physical and mental health, as well as good vision (+/- 0.7 with or without corrections). You need to be able to obtain a health certificate according to EASA Regulations. You can find more information about medical certification for Cabin Crew by clicking here.
• Employment also requires completed and passed drug and alcohol tests (blood and urine samples). These must be taken before the start of the course.
• Our premises and work are located within the airport’s security-related area. You must therefore have an exhaustive police certificate/clean record and be approved by the aviation authorities
• Application: once you have completed your application, we will assess your skills and experience.
• Online assessment: Considered applicants, will be required to complete a digital video which involves answering a pre-set question.
• Assessment Center: If your application is successful, next will be invitation to attend our assessment day.
• Pre-employment checks: Before employment can be offered you will need to complete various checks including reference checks, criminal record check, security clearance, medical examination and drug- and alcohol test.
• Cabin Crew Training – If you have passed all the requirements, you can start our 4-week Cabin Crew training program which will prepare you for a career in the sky.

In this fast-paced environment, you’ll rely on your adaptability and high work capacity to manage irregular hours and schedules. description:

=== Description ===
About Us:
AAP Aviation is a leading aviation company specializing in the transportation for transition and delivery of airplanes worldwide. We pride ourselves on our commitment to safety, efficiency, and quality, and is Part NCC approved by the Irish Aviation Authorities and 2REG Certified.
Job Description:
As a Ferry Flight Pilot at AAP Aviation, you will be responsible for the safety and efficiency of the flights, for reposition or demonstration. This role requires a high level of expertise such as flying skills, flight planning, navigation, and compliance with international regulations. You will work closely with our operations team to ensure timely and successful flights.
Key Responsibilities:
• Conduct pre-flight inspections and ensure aircraft are airworthy.
• Plan and execute ferry or demonstration flights, including confirmation of route planning and fuel management.
• Navigate and operate in diverse weather conditions.
• Ensure compliance with all regulatory requirements and company policies.
• Maintain accurate flight logs and reports.
• Communicate effectively with air traffic control and all support teams.
• Address and resolve any in-flight issues safely and efficiently.
Pilot-In-Command Qualification Requirements
Minimum qualification requirements to qualify a flight crew member to act as Pilot-In-Command on Company aircraft are:
• Airline Transport Pilot License (ATPL).
• Valid Type Rating(s) with the qualification as PIC including Instrument Rating.
• A total of at least 3000 flight hours on CAT fixed wing aircraft.
• 500 hours flight time on Multi Pilot, Multi-engine aircraft type
• 1000 hours flight time as PIC.
• Hold a valid Medical Class 1.
• Minimum ICAO ELP 4. Preferred 5 or 6
• Minimum 200 hours P1 on Jet Turbine for Jet Turbine Operations
The following requirements are applicable to PIC who are new to the type or to the Company or have completed a commander course:
• Has accumulated 50 hours of flight time under the supervision of a Company PIC. This PIC shall have experience of at least 100 hours flight time on the type.
Co-Pilot/Second in Command Qualification Requirements
Minimum requirements to qualify a flight crew member to act as co-pilot on Company aircraft are:
• Commercial Pilot License (ATPL).
• Valid type rating(s) with the qualification as PIC including Instrument Rating.
• A total of at least 1000 flight hours on CAT fixed wing aircraft and
• A total of at last 500 hours on type.
• 500 hours flight time under instrument rules.
• Hold a valid medical class 1.
• Minimum ICAO ELP 4. Preferer 5 or 6
• Minimum 100 hours P2 on Jet Turbine for Jet Turbine Operations.
